project_name.justification: The text consistently refers to the project by this name, for example: 'South Star Battery Metals Announces Exercise of Earn-in and Acquisition of 100% of the BamaStar Graphite Project in Coosa County, Alabama'.

company_name.justification: The acquiring company is identified at the beginning of the press release: 'South Star Battery Metals Corp. ("South Star " or the "Company") ... is pleased to announce that it has successfully exercised its right to earn-in 75% of the BamaStar Graphite Project...'

ceo_buyer.justification: The CEO of the acquiring company is named in the text: 'Richard Pearce, CEO of South Star commented...'

interest_acquired_percent.justification: South Star first earned 75% and then acquired the remaining 25%. The text states: '...successfully exercised its right to earn-in 75% of the BamaStar Graphite Project...' and '...all the Project partners (the "CML Owners") exercised their vendor option to sell the remaining 25% of the Project to South Star... On completion of the transfer... the Company will have 100% of the rights to the Project.'

primary_commodity.justification: The project is explicitly identified as a graphite project in the headline: '...Acquisition of 100% of the BamaStar Graphite Project...'

verified_article_link.justification: The article is about the BamaStar project acquisition by South Star Battery Metals Corp. The original press release link is provided at the bottom of the text: 'View the original press release on ACCESS Newswire'.

currency.justification: The currency is indicated by the 'C$' prefix in the payment and expenditure details: '...sell the remaining 25% of the Project to South Star for C$250,000 in common shares...' and '...Fund an annual minimum expenditure of C$250,000...'

share_payments_raw.justification: The acquisition of the remaining 25% interest was paid for with shares valued at C$250,000. '...sell the remaining 25% of the Project to South Star for C$250,000 in common shares of South Star...'
